metadata.title: CASE 192/04: Investigation Report on Allegation of Fraud at Pristina Airport

overview: This investigation report summarizes the findings from the Investigation Task Force on the allegations of fraudulent activities involving the Cargo Department at Pristina Airport. The focus of the case is on unauthorized payments for the handling and storage of goods, which were not properly documented in the official records.

applicable_laws.regulation_id: Article 22 of Criminal Code of SFRY

methodology.description: The investigation involved conducting interviews with key stakeholders and examining financial records and transaction documents associated with the alleged fraud.

background.context: The investigation targeted fraudulent financial practices within the Cargo Department at Pristina Airport, specifically illegal payments for importation and storage services.
timeline: 2003-12-26: Consignment of LED Display equipment arrived
2004-07-22: Case referred to Department of Justice

investigation_details.subject: Fraud allegations at Pristina Airport Cargo Department

allegations.description: Improper payment solicitation for goods importation and storage.
allegations.findings: An official illegally collected €8,000.00, unrecorded in the official accounts.

allegations.description: Failure to document €32,000.00 in storage fees.
allegations.findings: Interview with Official 2 revealed unexplained omissions in payment records.

allegations.description: Abuse of official position by neglecting to collect storage fees.
allegations.findings: Officials neglected their duties, resulting in significant revenue loss for the airport.

key_findings: Evidence of significant financial misconduct was discovered
assessments: Funds were mismanaged and unaccounted for
risks: Potential reputational damage to Pristina Airport and the involved company

findings: Fraud of €8,000.00 by a Pristina Airport official was substantiated
Sufficient evidence exists for potential judicial proceedings

actions: UNMIK Pillar IV should refrain from administrative actions against Officials 1 and 2 until the Department of Justice resolves their cases (IV04/192/01).
Appropriate disciplinary measures should be considered for Official 1 if not criminally charged (IV04/192/02).
Appropriate disciplinary measures should be considered for Official 2 if not criminally charged (IV04/192/03).
